page.title: 02TEST VALLEY LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is a lowland area which only rises to 62 m.The lowest land is about 5m.It is drained by two rivers;the river Test and its tributary the river Blackwater.The river Test flows south_ wards across its floodplain;flat land which is liable to flood in winter. Some land is marshy and has been drained by ditches.The river Blackwater is smaller and meanders through a narrow and steeper sided valley. The areas away from the river valley are gently sloping except for a ridge of highland which can be seen approaching the area from the south. This has steep slopes and separates the two rivers.There are several small lakes in the area found mainly in the wooded areas,the largest of which is Kentford Lake.
